c-0: ^"Yes… I suppose I do. Breakfast was good—especially the coffee. And the lady who brought it was kind, though… a bit elusive."
^"If you’d like, I can have more coffee sent in. Or perhaps some tea?"
^"No, thank you. I think I’ve had enough comforts for the moment."
^"What I’d like now is to know how it came to be that you’re my host."
c-1: ^"Yes. I didn’t expect full clarity just yet. It’s not unusual." a pause
c-2: ^"Sharp, huh? That’s generous. I’ve been feeling more like Mr. Blunt."
^"You’ve got a respectable setup here, Doctor. Shame I don’t remember checking in. Your name was on the door—mine, apparently, was in your files."
g-0: ^“You’re in Boston,” he says, pausing for a beat, “at my clinic.”

^“The police brought you here three nights ago—severely cold, and in a rather disturbed state. You were discovered near the waterfront, they told me. It took two days for your condition to stabilize.”
^He adjusts his posture slightly, eyes calm but attentive.
^“We spoke briefly yesterday about what happened, but…” another pause, longer this time, “…can you tell me, Mr. Sharpe—what took you to Gull Island?”
